channel.title: IGN News
channel.description: The latest IGN news, previews and features about video games, movies, TV, tech and comics

item.title: The Walking Dead Season 9: Synopsis, Images Released
item.description: Rick Grimes and the rest of the gang are enjoying a time of peace, but a new threat will soon enter the frame.
item.content:encoded:
The Walking Dead Season 9's synopsis has been released, teasing the new threats awaiting Rick Grimes and the rest of Alexandria.

The new Walking Dead season indeed takes place a year and a half after the war against Negan, with Rick leading the community in Alexandria during a time of peace. However, man-made structures are still continuing to crumble, representing a new obstacle for the survivors.

Rick will also have to worry about a new kind of threat heading toward Alexandria, which will threaten "the very idea of civilization."

Check out the full synopsis below, alongside several new images from Season 9:

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Alex Gilyadov

item.title: The Nun: Know Your Conjuring from Your Insidious
item.description: Casual fans may have a hard time telling these horror franchises about paranormal investigators apart, so we're spelling it out for you!
item.content:encoded:
The world was a simpler place before Insidious and The Conjuring came along. It used to be relatively easy to tell the major horror movie franchises apart. Freddy killed you in your dreams, Jason killed you at summer camp, Michael Myers only attacked on Halloween and Chucky was a plastic doll so he really stood out in a lineup.

But although hardcore horror fans know the Insidious and The Conjuring franchises intimately, and don’t need any sort of primer to keep them straight, casual fans sometimes run into problems. They’re two of the biggest horror movie franchises we have left and they have a heck of a lot in common.

Don't believe us? Read the following description and tell us whether we’re describing the Insidious horror movie franchise, or the Conjuring horror movie franchise:

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: William Bibbiani

item.title: Complete Guide to Spider-Man's Preorder Bonuses
item.description: Marvel's Spider-Man releases Friday, September 7, and you can grab some great bonuses by preordering right now.
item.content:encoded:
If you buy something through this post, IGN may get a share of the sale. For more, read our Terms of Use.

Spider-Man releases exclusively for PS4 on Friday, September 7, meaning you still have time to preorder. Preordering no longer has the same money-saving draw as it once did (unless your GCU membership is still active), but it will entitle you to some exclusive benefits. Let's take a look at who has the best price and what preorder exclusives (if any) are on offer for Spider-Man for PS4:

item.dc:creator: Seth G. Macy

item.title: Original Valkyria Chronicles Coming to Switch
item.description: Those who purchase the upcoming Valkyria Chronicles 4 will receive a 25-percent discount.
item.content:encoded:
Sega is bringing the original Valkyria Chronicles to Nintendo Switch later this year.

The first entry in the tactical role-playing series will be available on Switch via the eShop on October 16. The game will be priced at $20 USD and will feature all DLC.

Those who purchase the upcoming Valkyria Chronicles 4 through the Nintendo eShop will receive a 25 percent/$5 USD discount. This promotion will run from October 16 to December 17.

Meanwhile, Valkyria Chronicles 4 will be released on September 25 for Switch, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC.

Check out all of the game's preorder bonuses and learn more about Valkyria Chronicles 4's new class, the Grenadier.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Alex Gilyadov

item.title: Typhoon Knocks 'N' off of Nintendo Headquarters Sign
item.description: Typhoon Jebi has been causing catastrophic damage to Japanese infrastructure, with the Nintendo building suffering some of the storm.
item.content:encoded:
A terrible storm that has been making its way through Japan's Kansai region has removed the 'N' from the Nintendo logo at the company's Kyoto headquarters.

The news was revealed due to a series of photos posted to Twitter from users FlorentGorgesFR and nicoryuuga.

The highly dangerous Typhoon Jebi has caused the damage, ripping the letter from the iconic sign.

台風の影響で

ニンテンドー が インテンドー

になってた#任天堂#京都 #台風21号 pic.twitter.com/Z7UrWBHcEk

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Jordan Oloman

item.title: Anthem Will Be a 'Complete Package' on Day One, Says Producer
item.description: Executive Producer Mark Darrah says the day one content will keep players busy for months.
item.content:encoded:
With Anthem, BioWare is keen to avoid the problem many games have run into as of late, with the perception that, at launch, releases may be "incomplete."

Speaking to USGamer during PAX West, Executive Producer Mark Darrah said he feels consumers will be getting "a good, valuable game" when Anthem launches. And while more content will naturally be added post-launch, Darrah promised there will be plenty to keep players going for the long haul right out of the gate.

"You would be able to play for months and months. Even if we weren't then layering a live service on top of it," said Darrah of BioWare's launch day goals for Anthem. "So, I think it's an excellent value right off the start. You know, four Exosuits, a complete story. So, both I think it's a complete package but it's also the starting line of an experience as well."

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Nick Santangelo

item.title: Fortnite: Cube Movement Theories and Season 6 Speculation Is Running High Among Avid Fans
item.description: Predicting the rune locations of the cube has become a continuous effort in the Fortnite community and a few players believe they found a potential pattern.
item.content:encoded:
Two notable Fortnite theories claim to predict the rest of the movement path for the mysterious cube that randomly appeared in-game 11 days ago.

The cube has been on the move since it first zapped into the desert biome, and its slow migration sees it turn on one side every so often. At one point the cube moved every hour and 43 minutes but now its movements are irregular. On two occasions, the cube left a mysterious rune in the ground with a surrounding field of anti-gravity. A third rune is likely to appear today.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Michael Koczwara

item.title: The Asgardians of the Galaxy Have a Secret Weapon
item.description: There's more to Marvel's newest superhero team than we realized. Spoilers ahead!
item.content:encoded:
Asgardians of the Galaxy debuts Marvel's newest cosmic superhero team, and it turns out that these heroes have an unexpected ace up their sleeve.

Warning: this article contains spoilers for Asgardians of the Galaxy #1!

This new series launches as a spinoff of the current Infinity Wars crossover, with Angela, Valkyrie, Skurge, Thunderstrike, Throg and the Destroyer Armor rising up to help protect a Marvel Universe left defenseless in the absence of the Guardians of the Galaxy. The new team's first nemesis is none other than Nebula, daughter of Thanos.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Jesse Schedeen

item.dc:creator: Jessie Wade

item.title: Doom Patrol Casts James Bond's Timothy Dalton in Leading Role
item.description: Dalton will portray Dr. Niles "The Chief" Caulder on the live-action DC show.
item.content:encoded:
Former James Bond star Timothy Dalton has joined DC's live-action Doom Patrol series.

Per THR, Dalton will portray Dr. Niles "The Chief" Caulder, a mad scientist who leads the titular superhero team. The character is both controversial and brilliant, and a pioneer in medical science.

This will be Dalton's first regular TV role since Penny Dreadful, where he starred as Sir Malcolm Murray. Dalton also played James Bond in The Living Daylights and License to Kill.

The rest of Doom Patrol's cast includes Brendan Fraser as Robotman, Dwain Murphy as Negative Man, April Bowlby as Elasti-Woman, and Diane Guerrero as Crazy Jane. Alan Tudyk has also joined the ensemble as Mr. Nobody.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Alex Gilyadov

item.title: House of Cards: Frank Underwood's Fate in Final Season Revealed
item.description: Kevin Spacey was dropped from the show's final season following allegations of sexual misconduct.
item.content:encoded:
House of Cards' latest teaser has revealed the fate of Kevin Spacey's character, Frank Underwood.

Spoilers ahead for the next season of House of Cards

Per Twitter, the teaser promptly features the new president Claire Underwood (Robin Wright) standing next to Frank's grave. According to the ex-president's headstone, he died sometime in 2017.

You should have known. pic.twitter.com/UFGplyDSY1

— House of Cards (@HouseofCards) September 5, 2018

item.dc:creator: Alex Gilyadov

item.title: Two New PSVR Bundles Are Coming This Fall
item.description: Creed: Rise to Glory and Astro Bot Rescue Mission are getting their own PSVR bundles, each with another game packed in.
item.content:encoded:
Sony announced today a pair of new PlayStation VR Bundles coming this fall.

First up is the PSVR Creed: Rise to Glory and Superhot VR Bundle, which will arrive at retail on Sept. 25 for $349.99 USD / $449.99 CAD. Included in the bundle will be one PSVR system, one PlayStation Camera, a demo disc 2.0, a pair of PlayStation Move controllers, a digital vouchers for Superhot VR, and a Creed: Rise to Glory disc.

PSVR's Astro Bot Rescue Mission and Moss Bundle will follow on Oct. 2 for $299.99 USD / $379.99 CAD. This more budget-friendly bundle doesn't contain any Move controllers and swaps out Creed and Superhot for a Moss digital voucher and an Astro Bot Rescue Mission disc.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Nick Santangelo

item.title: Captain Marvel: First Official Photo Revealed
item.description: Get your first look at Brie Larson as the latest addition to the MCU.
item.content:encoded:
The first official image of Brie Larson as Captain Marvel has been revealed.

Revealed on EW's new issue cover, the superhero's suit is familiar, but has been tweaked from the comics for its MCU debut:

EW's report confirms that this is not a traditional origin story, beginning after Carol Danvers already has her powers, and has joined a Kree military team called Starforce. Taking place in the '90s, Samuel L. Jackson will play a younger Nick Fury, complete with both eyes and a desk job at S.H.I.E.L.D.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Joe Skrebels

item.title: How Captain Marvel's Movie Fits In Before Avengers 4
item.description: Here's a breakdown of everything we know about Captain Marvel's movie debut.
item.content:encoded:
Spoilers follow for Avengers: Infinity War!

With the first official photos of Brie Larson's Captain Marvel revealed today, and while we wait for the trailer for the movie, let's take a look at everything we know about the character's much-anticipated film and how she will fit into the MCU.

As that symbol showed up at the end of Avengers: Infinity War in the after credit scene, attention began turning to Marvel Studios' 2019 lineup. Next year will kick off with Captain Marvel, a movie that marks the debut of Brie Larson as Air Force pilot-turned cosmic superhero Carol Danvers and has a release date of March 6, 2019.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Jesse Schedeen

item.title: 35-Minute Nintendo Switch and 3DS Direct Announced
item.description: Nintendo has announced yet another Direct that will air tomorrow, September 6, at 3 pm PT/6 pm ET and will focus on upcoming titles for the Nintendo Switch and 3DS.
item.content:encoded:
Nintendo has announced yet another Direct that will air tomorrow, September 6, at 3 pm PT/6 pm ET/11 pm BST and will focus on upcoming titles for the Nintendo Switch and 3DS.

Announced by Nintendo’s Twitter, this 35-minute Nintendo Direct will be their fourth Direct-style video since Nintendo UK released its Indie Highlights video and discussed 16 games headed to the Switch on August 20.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Adam Bankhurst

item.title: Doctor Who: Season 11 Debuts In October
item.description: The veteran sci-fi series returns in October, on a brand new day.
item.content:encoded:
In recent weeks and months, there has been a slow but steady trickle of information coming from the BBC regarding Doctor Who's upcoming eleventh season, with the first trailer whetting fans' appetites and the reveal of a diverse group of writers and directors hyping the show in advance of its return. Now the BBC has finally revealed when Doctor Who will be back, and there's a big change: Season 11 will premiere Sunday, October 7 in both the UK and the US, with the premiere airing a day later in Australia.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Matt Davidson

item.title: It's Always Sunny Premiere Sneak Peek: Meet the New Dennis
item.description: In our exclusive IGN First sneak peek at the Season 13 premiere of It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, the gang is trying to replace Dennis with some unusual candidates.
item.content:encoded:
All September long, IGN is spotlighting the best TV coming your way in the 2018-2019 season. Today we're taking a look at FXX's beloved comedy, It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, which premieres its 13th season on Sept. 5 with the gang attempting to find a new candidate to replace Dennis (Glenn Howerton), following his departure in the Season 12 finale.

The Season 13 premiere of It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia marks a big change in the status quo for the gang - Dennis Reynolds has left to become a father in North Dakota, leaving a hole in Paddy's Pub that our characters (okay, mostly just Mac) are desperate to fill.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Laura Prudom

item.title: Fallout 76: Bethesda Reveals Campaign Details
item.description: Although the game places heavy emphasis on survival, there will still be a main story - with a nuclear conclusion.
item.content:encoded:
Bethesda has revealed a few more details about Fallout 76's campaign, including how finishing it will reward the player.

Although the game will place a heavy emphasis on multiplayer opportunities and survival - when announced, Bethesda referred to it as an "online survival RPG" - that doesn't mean that it's giving up the series' traditional story-based elements, with the game's development team clarifying that Fallout 76 is still "driven by quests".

The news comes from Game Informer's latest feature on the game, with the developers revealing that the game's "main quest" storyline will revolve around the mysterious disappearance of Vault 76's Overseer. Bethesda's director Todd Howard explains that "she left before everybody", leaving behind secret instructions for the player, who receives a transmission from her upon leaving the Vault. This transmission, and the instructions left behind, will drive the player through the game's main storyline - which will end with the player gaining access to the game's nukes.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Matt Davidson
